discourse_list.title: EIP-1637 - Adding chainId parameter to eth_sendTransaction

content.content: Following the discussion from the Wallet ring regarding a new scope of JSON-RPC methods prefixed with wallet_ to improve Wallet UX, I propose that existing signing methods such as eth_sendTransaction, eth_sendRawTransaction and eth_signTransaction would benefit a lot from a small change that would be backwards-compatible and easily changed by major JS libraries used as middleware between Dapps and Wallets   github.com/ethereum/EIPs      Issue: EIP 1637 - Adding chainId parameter to eth_sendTransaction  	 	opened by pedrouid 	on 2018-12-04 	 	 	  Currently we rely in non-standard middleware to handle the state of the active chain of the Wallet. This state could be...
content.GPT-summary: The author is proposing a change to existing signing methods in order to improve Wallet UX. The proposal is to add a chainId parameter to eth_sendTransaction, eth_sendRawTransaction and eth_signTransaction. The author explains that this change would be backwards-compatible and easily changed by major JS libraries used as middleware between Dapps and Wallets. A 3rd party is giving constructive criticism of the proposal and asking questions about it.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
